name: query
description:
Execute a structured JSON query against Affinity data. Supports filtering, includes, aggregates, and multiple output formats.

Query structure:
- from: Entity type ('persons', 'companies', 'opportunities', 'listEntries', 'interactions', 'notes')
- where: Filter conditions with operators (eq, neq, gt, gte, lt, lte, contains, starts_with, ends_with, in, between, is_null, is_not_null, is_empty, has_any, has_all, contains_any, contains_all)
- include: Related entities to fetch (e.g., ['companies', 'opportunities', 'listEntries'] for persons). Note: companies/opportunities use 'people' not 'persons'
- select: Fields to return (default: all). Use 'fields.*' for all custom fields on listEntries
- orderBy: Sort results [{field, direction}]
- groupBy: Group by field for aggregates (e.g., 'fields.Status' for listEntries)
- aggregate: Compute aggregates {alias: {sum/avg/count/min/max: field}}
- limit: Max records to return

Multi-select field filtering:
- eq with scalar value: checks if value is in the array (membership)
- eq with array value: checks set equality (order-insensitive)
- has_any: checks if array contains any of the specified values
- has_all: checks if array contains all of the specified values
- contains_any: any array element contains any substring (case-insensitive)
- contains_all: array elements collectively contain all substrings (case-insensitive)

listEntries queries:
- Require 'listId' or 'listName' filter (listName resolves to ID at runtime)
- Custom field values are auto-fetched when referenced in groupBy, aggregate, or where
- Use 'fields.<FieldName>' paths for custom list fields

Examples:
- {"from": "persons", "where": {"path": "email", "op": "contains", "value": "@acme.com"}, "limit": 50}
- {"from": "listEntries", "where": {"path": "listName", "op": "eq", "value": "Dealflow"}, "groupBy": "fields.Status", "aggregate": {"count": {"count": true}}}
- {"from": "listEntries", "where": {"and_": [{"path": "listName", "op": "eq", "value": "Dealflow"}, {"path": "fields.Team Member", "op": "eq", "value": "LB"}]}}
- {"from": "opportunities", "include": ["companies"], "orderBy": [{"field": "created_at", "direction": "desc"}]}

Performance notes:
- Includes cause N+1 API calls (1 per parent record) - use dryRun to preview
- Use dryRun=true to preview the execution plan with estimated API calls before running

query.description: JSON query object with 'from' (required) and optional where, include, select, orderBy, groupBy, aggregate, having, limit fields.

where.description: Filter conditions. Simple: {path, op, value}. Compound: {and_: [...]} or {or_: [...]}

groupBy.description: Field to group by for aggregates

dryRun.description: If true, return the execution plan with estimated API calls without running the query.

maxRecords.description: Safety limit for maximum records to fetch (default 1000, max 10000).

maxOutputBytes.description: Maximum output size in bytes (default 50000). Larger outputs are truncated.

format.description: Output format. Use 'markdown' for analysis (best LLM comprehension), 'toon' for large datasets (40% fewer tokens), 'json' for programmatic processing.
